alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison and southwestern Jackson Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Kiln to near Gulfport. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and tropical funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, St. Martin, D`iberville, Latimer, Lyman, Saucier, Gulf Hills, Gulf Park Estates, Vancleave and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 19 and 57. Interstate 110 in Mississippi near mile marker 1, and between mile markers 3 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
